oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A new physical insight and 3D device modeling of sti type denmos device failure under ESD conditions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHRIVASTAVA, M
SCHNEIDER, J
BAGHINI, MS
GOSSNER, H
RAO, VR
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present experimental and simulation studies of STI type DeNMOS devices under ESD conditions. The impact of base-push-out, power dissipation because of space charge build-up and, regenerative NPN action, on the various phases of filamentation and the final thermal runaway is discussed. A modification of the device layout is proposed to achieve an improvement (similar to 2X) infailure threshold (I(T2)).
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: 2009 IEEE INTERNATIONAL RELIABILITY PHYSICS SYMPOSIUM, VOLS 1 AND 2,669-675
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 47th Annual IEEE International Reliability Physics Symposium,Montreal, CANADA,APR 26-30, 2009
